definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
from the bottom of one's heart (idiom)
genius comes from hard effort/Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration (Thomas Edison)
pinyin: tian1 cai2 chu1 zi4 qin2 fen4

sentences.english: It is the spirit in which they are said which is all-important .
sentences.chinese: 這些話語所出自的靈纔是最重要的。

sentences.english: This epitome of richness dates back to 18th century Ottoman Empire.
sentences.chinese: 這件象徵財富的作品出自18世紀的奧斯曼帝國。

sentences.english: From award winning Hong Kong directors Alan Mak and Andrew Lau.
sentences.chinese: 出自於得過獎的香港導演麥兆輝與劉偉強。

sentences.english: This hairdresser designs this elegant and graceful hair-style.
sentences.chinese: 這種典雅大方的髮式出自這位理髮師之手。

sentences.english: The painting rises from the brushstrokes as a poem rises from the words.
sentences.chinese: 繪畫出自於筆刷正如詩歌出自於詞語。

sentences.english: The painting rises from the brushstrokes as a poem rises from the words.
sentences.chinese: 繪畫出自於筆刷正如詩歌出自於詞語。

sentences.english: Than in the breath that from my mistress reeks.
sentences.chinese: 比出自我情人口中的氣息。

sentences.english: Meaning no longer inheres in the text, but is fully located within the reading community.
sentences.chinese: 意義不再出自文本，而完全在閱讀羣體之中。

sentences.english: For the Teaching comes from Zion, and from Jerusalem the word of Yahweh.
sentences.chinese: 因爲法律將出自熙雍，上主的話將出自耶路撒冷。

sentences.english: For the Teaching comes from Zion, and from Jerusalem the word of Yahweh.
sentences.chinese: 因爲法律將出自熙雍，上主的話將出自耶路撒冷。

sentences.english: The island of Sardinia is home to some of the world's oldest people.
sentences.chinese: 世界上很多最長壽的老人都出自撒丁島。

sentences.english: Lesbianism gained its name from the Greek island of Lesbos.
sentences.chinese: 女同性戀者的名稱出自希臘的萊斯博斯島。

sentences.english: Long There is no doubt that the Hongshan culture from the Northeast.
sentences.chinese: 龍毫無疑問，就是出自東北地區的紅山文化。

sentences.english: The manifestations of the law at different scales exhibit approximate self-similarity. Newton called it 'Nature conformable to Herself.
sentences.chinese: 這些規律的在不同的尺度上顯示出自相似性。

sentences.english: I wish I'd written the words on this beautiful card.
sentences.chinese: 我多麼希望這張美麗的卡片上的話語出自我的筆下。

sentences.english: This tradition is also believed to come from the Thracians who may have danced similarly during Dionysian rituals.
sentences.chinese: 這項傳統據信是出自色雷斯人酒神節中類似的舞蹈。

definition: source (esp. of quotation or literary allusion)/origin/where sth comes from
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
to quote/to cite/to recommend/to appoint/(computing) reference
classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
what's frequently heard can be repeated in detail (idiom)
traceable to the same stock (idiom); of a common origin (of trends, ideas etc)
handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
